intro: Valeriana pipenbergica, commonly known as the Swedish valerian, is a flowering plant native to northern Europe. It is a member of the Caprifoliaceae family and is characterized by its square, hairy stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or white, which bloom in summer. Valeriana pipenbergica is often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. It is valued for its aromatic properties and has been used traditionally in herbal medicine.
